Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo home run in the eighth inning to give the Yankees a 3-2 win over the Royals in ALDS Game 3, lifting them to a 2-1 series lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised Stanton's clutch performance and focus in big moments.
The Yankees bullpen tossed 4 1/3 shutout innings in relief, continuing their strong series performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals struggled to score with runners in scoring position, going 0-for-6 in the series up to that point.
Clarke Schmidt started the game for the Yankees but was relieved by a strong bullpen performance.
